intro: Sulcorebutia losenickyana var. chatajillensis, commonly known as the Chatajillensis Pincushion Cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It features a short, cylindrical stem with a dense covering of white, woolly hairs that help reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil. This variety is prized for its unique appearance and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
